div.p: Configurable Heat Grid / Heatmap visualization that can be used to show the quick status or health of many items at once. Support for grouping, and can display as hexagons, squares, diamonds or circles. Fully customisable tooltips, drilldown support, and numerous color schemes. Works in dark-mode.
Copyright (C) 2021 Chris Younger | Source code | Splunkbase | Questions, Bugs or Suggestions | My Splunk apps

This visualisation expects data with specific field names. Use | rename to make sure your fields match what is expected. Every row of data will become a cell in the heatgrid. Data must always have "value" or "color" field (not both). If the "value" field is provided, the color will be automatically set based on the selected color gradiant. It is also possible to explicitly set color in the data by providing a "color" field.
These are the fields that can be provided in data:

tr.td: This is the value that is used to determine the color of this cell. By default expected range is between 0 and 100. If the range of your data is different, then change the 'data range' option in the 'format' menu. Either this or the 'color' field below is mandatory.
The color of the cell can be explicity set by passing in a valid html color code (E.g. "#FFFFFF", "red", or "rga(0,255,0)"). Either this or 'value' field above must be supplied.
The contents to show on the tooltip when this cell is hovered.
Specify what value should be shown on the tooltip when hovering this cell. For example, to set a % sign: | eval tooltip_value = value + " %"

Providing this field will override the other tooltip fields and will allow fully custom HTML content. For example: | eval tooltip_html = "Location: Sydney</br>Owner: Operations</br>Value: <strong>" + value + " %<strong>"

If the group field is provided then cells with the same value will be grouped together with a label. Note that groups with only a few items in them may not layout very well. Squares and hexagons shapes allow for the most efficient use of space.
If supplied, clicking the cell will cause a token to be set with this value. The default token is heatgrid_viz_drilldown but it can be changed in the 'Format' menu.
If supplied, will cause this URL to be opened in a new tab/window when the cell is clicked.

ul.li: If an "override color" is set, this will always override the selected color scheme.
The "override color" can be a single HTML color code (e.g. #00ff00) and a color gradiant will be generated automatically. Otherwise set a space separated list of multiple color codes.

html.p: Note that tooltip and tooltip_value are optional

search.query: | makeresults count=3 | streamstats count as id | eval value = if((random()%5) == 1, random()%100, random()%10) | eval tooltip = "SERVER" + id | eval tooltip_value = value + " %" | table tooltip value tooltip_value

viz.title: will produce a result like this:

search.query: | makeresults count=1000 | streamstats count as id | eval value = if((random()%5) == 1, random()%100, random()%10) | eval tooltip = "SERVER" + id | eval tooltip_value = value + " %" | table tooltip value tooltip_value

html.h1: Example with grouping, custom HTML tooltips and drill-down

search.query:
| makeresults count=5 | streamstats count as id | eval value = if((random()%5) == 1, random()%100, random()%10) | eval tooltip_html = "SERVER" + id + "
Location: Sydney
Owner: Operations
CPU: " + value + "%" | eval random = random()%100 | eval group = case(random < 50, "Production", random < 80, "Testing", true(), "Development") | eval drilldown = "servers?host=" + "SERVER" + id | eventstats count by group | eval group = group + " (" + count + " items)" | table value group drilldown tooltip_html

viz.title: will produce a result like this:

search.query:
| makeresults count=100 | streamstats count as id | eval value = if((random()%5) == 1, random()%100, random()%10) | eval tooltip = "SERVER" + id | eval tooltip_html = "SERVER" + id + "
Location: Sydney
Owner: Operations
CPU: " + value + "%" | eval random = random()%100 | eval group = case(random < 50, "Production", random < 80, "Testing", true(), "Development") | eval drilldown = "servers?host=" + tooltip | eventstats count by group | eval group = group + " (" + count + " items)" | sort 0 - count | table tooltip value group tooltip_html drilldown

html.h1: Example with the color set in the data (rather than using "value" field)

search.query: | makeresults count=5 | streamstats count as id | eval tooltip = "SERVER" + id | eval tooltip_value = if((random()%5) == 1, "Offline", "Online") | eval color = if(tooltip_value == "Offline", "#EE174B", "#6DD381") | table tooltip tooltip_value color

viz.title: will produce a result like this:

search.query: | makeresults count=100 | streamstats count as id | eval tooltip = "SERVER" + id | eval tooltip_value = if((random()%30) == 1, "Offline", "Online") | eval color = if(tooltip_value == "Offline", "#EE174B", "#6DD381") | table tooltip tooltip_value color
